context: The Estonian word 'ohutu' is an adjective meaning 'safe' or 'harmless'. It refers to something that does not cause danger, accidents, or anything bad. The word can be declined in various forms including comparative (ohutum - safer) and superlative (kõige ohutum - safest). Examples include 'ohutu liiklus' (safe traffic), 'ohutud töötingimused' (safe working conditions), and 'Suitsetamine pole kaugeltki ohutu' (Smoking is not safe at all).
